label: 八省院
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hasshōin (J.) 八省院, also called 朝堂院 Chōdōin. This administrative palace in the greater imperial palace as a rule was the site of all national rites, but gradually the Shishinden of the inner palace became the location for the performance of many rites of the court.
